title: What's your story?
body:
Hello again! Last post, we asked oyu to share their greatest League story, whatever it might be. This time, we've narrowed it down to a few types of tales in particular:
 
Do you ever fight your inner demons in game, after [missing an easy skillshot](http://imgur.com/gallery/l4hH7oP) or [struggling to keep your ADC safe](http://imgur.com/7HiVka1)? Tell us about how your perspective has changed while playing League.
As a gamer, how does your League life influence your IRL? (we’d love to hear from the ladies here, especially).
Submissions are welcome from all regions!
 
Whatever your story is, tell us why your’s is different than any other. We're looking for only the most unique and extraordinary. Even if you aren’t the protagonist, share with us at playerstories-rg@riotgames.com or in the comments below.

replies.body:
i am kinda a new player to the LOL world, been playing since early dec last year
really like the game, keeps my brain sharp in a way
does the game influence my life? so far i don't know... 
i guess i haven't played enough to have it affect my life i suppose?

as request by the friend that got me into the LOL world, i have become a full time support char player 
well 80%... i guess?
Mainly Soraka, lately i've been learning Sona and Nami, and other support type like Lulu and such
i don't know if this count as "fighting your inner demons"... 
coz i kinda didn't fight it lol
but 
I HATE supporting Yasuo

as the game gets into mid stage when my ADC, or who ever i am supporting is all set, 
i sometimes move around lanes supporting other hero to push lines or chase enemy ect
this has happened many time, that, when a yasuo player sees me coming (especially when i am using Soraka)
and BEFORE i get into a good range to support
he/she would suddenly gets really brave and starts dashing forword with that dashing skill of his
moving away from me, generally into enemy group of 3 or more
so i would have to chase after yasuo, trying to heal him and keep him alife 
when dead, yasuo would complain "why didn't u heal me!"

well i even used my ult because i wouldn't get in healing range in time yasuo san... 
you dash too fast into enemy group...
anata wa aho?

most player i supported are smart, i can tell they try to stay with in close range of me, 
or wait for me to catch up before engaging enemy
but YASUO!!! *********** YASUO!!!!
no one else does this, but yasuo, i really don't know why...

so... 
atm i got into a bad habit where sometime i would walk up to a Yasuo player
especially the one who KS a lot for no reason
pretending i'm gonna support him, and just sit back and watch him rush into enemy and die...
don't get me wrong, i really love playing support char
i love helping players to get their kills and save their life when in need
but Yasuo... 
you... and only you... 

i know this is a really bad thing to do....
i guess everyone has a dark side, a demon with in...
and this is mine

=========================================================

dear all Yasuo players who loves to dash into enemy(s)
please wait for your support hero to get into a good supporting range before engaging enemy
thank you
i am well aware of that, thank you{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

oh

What have I learned? I have learned never trust somebody that says I main mid il carry hard plz let me mid because yeah... they feed
Gonna sound cheesy here, but I've learned that the values and thought process you need to be good at League, are exactly the same as what people look for in a person IRL.

As someone with mental illness and little to no control over my rage, playing video games (especially LoL) allow me to vent stress and anger so that it doesn't influence my real life.
While I've eliminated raging in game at people so that I can't get reported and banned, my friends get to hear my yelling through Skype/Discord.

As much as I hate people being stupid, feeding, and trolling in LoL they do help me by being an object that I can focus my rage at to vent over.

(Note. Many people say "just take medication to control your emotions with" but most medications I could take would mean I can no longer work in a lab.)

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Raging irl does not produce results.
